species.name: Bengal Tiger
species.description: The majestic Bengal Tiger, India's national animal, shows promising recovery through advanced conservation technology and expanded protected areas.
funFacts: Tigers can leap up to 9 meters horizontally
Each tiger's stripe pattern is unique like a fingerprint
By 2070, AI-powered tracking helps monitor every tiger in real-time

species.name: Asian Elephant
species.description: Asian Elephants benefit from revolutionary wildlife corridor networks and AI-monitored migration routes by 2070.
funFacts: Elephants can communicate through infrasonic calls up to 6 km away
They mourn their dead and have been observed performing 'funeral' rituals
2070 smart corridors use elephant-specific traffic signals

species.name: Greater One-Horned Rhinoceros
species.description: The Greater One-Horned Rhino's population flourishes with drone surveillance and genetic diversity programs.
funFacts: Their 'horn' is actually made of keratin, like human hair
They're excellent swimmers despite their bulky appearance
2070 biobanks preserve genetic diversity for future generations

species.name: Snow Leopard
species.description: Snow Leopards adapt to changing Himalayan climates with assisted migration and climate-resilient habitats.
funFacts: They can't roar, only purr and chuff
Their large paws act like natural snowshoes
2070 climate shelters provide refuge during extreme weather

species.name: Red Panda
species.description: Red Pandas thrive in restored bamboo forests and climate-controlled breeding facilities by 2070.
funFacts: They were discovered before Giant Pandas
Red Pandas spend most of their time in trees
2070 bamboo farms ensure year-round food supply

species.name: Asiatic Lion
species.description: Asiatic Lions expand beyond Gir with successful translocation programs and genetic enhancement by 2070.
funFacts: They have a fold of skin along their belly that tigers lack
Asiatic Lions live in smaller prides than African lions
2070 genetic programs ensure healthy population diversity
